activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alicia A Turner

records.addlTxt: DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
HF emailed RPD to vacate warrant

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim D.P and the witness G.J (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:36 PM Defendant Alicia A Turner in court.  Prosecuting attorney Azucena C Guizar Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered, bond set. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:51 PM Defendant Alicia A Turner not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Azucena C Guizar Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defendant does not appear. 
BTC: WARRANT WILL REMAIN. Bond forfeiture is granted.
Warrant sent via email to RPD for entry.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alicia A Turner not in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
